On diesel engines, fuel injection is a necessity, whilst on petrol engines fuel injection is an alternative to the carburetor. In piston aircraft engines, continuous-flow fuel injection is the most common type. In contrast to automotive fuel injection systems, aircraft continuous flow fuel injection is all mechanical, requiring no electricity to operate.
